text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Yamano was born in Osaka Prefecture on April 5, 1955. After graduating from Osaka University of Commerce, he joined his local club Yanmar Diesel in 1978. The club won the Japan Soccer League champions in 1980. The club also won 1983 and 1984 JSL Cup. He played 125 matches for the club until 1984. In 1986, he signed with Japan Soccer League Division 2 club Osaka Gas. He retired in 1991. On June 11, 1980, Yamano debuted for the Japan national team against China. He played 2 games for Japan in 1980. ==Statistics== Japan National Football Team Database |- |1980||2||0 |- !Total||2||0 |} ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Osaka Prefecture Category:Japan international footballers Category:Japan Soccer League players Category:Cerezo Osaka players
title: Takayoshi Yamano
